thread.title: Free stuff: Bayou-side park celebrates grand opening

title: Free stuff: Bayou-side park celebrates grand opening
text:
Photo: Katya Horner Image 1 of / 5 5 Buffalo Bayou Park celebrates its grand opening on Saturday﻿.
Photo: Katya Horner Buffalo Bayou Park celebrates its grand opening on Saturday﻿. Image 2 of 5 Regis Prograis, a boxer, works out with a group of fellow boxers in Buffalo Bayou Park Thursday, Sept. 17, 2015, in Houston. ( Jon Shapley / Houston Chronicle )
Photo: Jon Shapley, Staff Regis Prograis, a boxer, works out with a group of fellow boxers in... Image 3 of 5 Rosemont Bridge is seen from the Memorial Drive side of Buffalo Bayou Thursday, Sept. 17, 2015, in Houston. ( Jon Shapley / Houston Chronicle )
Photo: Jon Shapley, Staff Rosemont Bridge is seen from the Memorial Drive side of Buffalo... Image 4 of 5 A jogger runs across Rosemont Bridge Thursday, Sept. 17, 2015, in Houston. ( Jon Shapley / Houston Chronicle )
Photo: Jon Shapley, Staff A jogger runs across Rosemont Bridge Thursday, Sept. 17, 2015, in... Image 5 of 5 Scott Garrison gives water to his dogs Elly, right, and Barney as they stop near Sabine Street and Allen Parkway Thursday, Sept. 17, 2015, in Houston. ( Jon Shapley / Houston Chronicle )
Photo: Jon Shapley, Staff Scott Garrison gives water to his dogs Elly, right, and Barney as... Free stuff: Bayou-side park celebrates grand opening 1 / 5 Back to Gallery Heritage Family Day
This annual event will celebrate the diversity of Asian cultures in Houston. Guests will tour the new exhibit "Asian Americans in Houston: A Kaleidoscope of Cultures," as well as see performances by a Chinese dance troupe and Japanese drummers. Other activities include games and crafts.
When: 1-4 p.m. Sunday
Where: 1100 Bagby
Information: heritagesociety.org
Cigna Sunday Streets
The fall edition of Cigna Sunday Streets kicks off this weekend. Washington Avenue from Westcott to Heights Boulevard will be closed to vehicular traffic for four hours. Families are encouraged to walk and bike along the boulevard. The event is part of a city initiative to encourage physical activity.
When: noon-4 p.m. Sunday
Information: gohealthyhouston.org
Buffalo Bayou Park
Stretching from Shepherd to Sabine, the 160-acre Buffalo Bayou Park will celebrate its grand opening with a day of activities, including live music, walking tours, children's crafts, a beer garden and a food-truck gathering. The event will culminate with an illuminated procession and a fireworks show.
When: 1:30-9:30 p.m. Saturday
Where: 105 Sabine
Information: buffalobayou.org
